commit_message:
add jobs to publish library from governance repo

We've recently added code to the openstack/governance repository to
make a public API for consuming the data that, to make that easier and
to make it easier for us to change the data format over time. This patch
adds the release job needed to publish releases of the code to PyPI.

Change-Id: Ib180ff2af737e2eeab5f61b773f453357fafdede
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Remove ansible-role-redhat-subscription from central repo

[{'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-11-14 15:09:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-11-14 15:21:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-11-14 16:30:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

they removed the server job and everything has been switched to the pypi job. It is correct that we don't need the pypi integration but there isn't currently a release job that handles that. We'd need to write one"}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-11-15 13:40:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> they removed the server job and everything has been switched to the
 > pypi job. It is correct that we don't need the pypi integration but
 > there isn't currently a release job that handles that. We'd need to
 > write one

So, what if we change it to noop-jobs template? Would there be any problem on that? I can see several ansible-role projects using that one."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-11-15 13:43:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

you can just remove the jobs here completely - no need for noop jobs since the repos have in-tree configuration in zuul.d/ repositories.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-11-15 13:43:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I thought we needed some release job defined in projects.yaml?'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-11-15 13:46:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Sean, you need it be defined if you want to push out.

If you don't release - or only tag without any uploads/announcement, you can remove.

I agree with Alex: We need new jobs defined and should use them.

So, my suggestion: Abandon this - work on the jobs, change the repos to use the job."}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-11-15 14:11:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Sean, you need it be defined if you want to push out.
 > 
 > If you don't release - or only tag without any uploads/announcement,
 > you can remove.
 > 
 > I agree with Alex: We need new jobs defined and should use them.
 > 
 > So, my suggestion: Abandon this - work on the jobs, change the
 > repos to use the job.

Ok, that makes sense. I'll ask Alex for help about the new jobs definition, but mainly we need to create a job for those projects which won't be published to pypi, right?. Thanks for the info"}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-11-15 16:10:36.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Let's add a job template for these kind of projects"}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-11-21 12:43:46.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

Instead of using release-openstack-server, use ansible-role-jobs'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-11-21 12:46:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-11-21 18:06:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

I suggest to add ansible-role-jobs in-repo and just remove the pypi here.

Jobs and templates like ansible-role-jobs should not be in a central repo anymore.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-11-27 11:21:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-11-28 10:18:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-11-28 14:43:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Hi @Andreas, is this ok? We're defining a template inside tripleo-ci for this type of ansible projects: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/620353/ and we'll move other ansible-role projects from this central repo to be using this template within their in-repo zuul configuration in future patches. But right now we need to unblock the validation failing or this project (it's not uploaded to pypi) https://review.openstack.org/#/c/616632/, as we need to create a new package. 
Thanks."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-11-29 13:40:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-11-29 13:43:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-11-29 16:05:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9061, 'date': '2018-11-29 22:29:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-14 15:09:20.000000000', 'message': "ansible-role-redhat-subscription: switch to non-pypi jobs

Switch the release jobs for ansible-role-redhat-subscription to non-pypi,
this is an Ansible module, we don't want it in pypi.

Change-Id: I1611db9a3c4f89d3cb40d3c253b4e91f8201d443
"}, {'created': '2018-11-14 15:21:25.000000000', 'message': "ansible-role-* projects switch to non-pypi jobs

Switch the release jobs for ansible-role-redhat-subscription,
ansible-role-container-registry and ansible-role-chrony to non-pypi,
these projects are Ansible modules, we don't want it in pypi.

Besides, they are not published into pypi and any new release
request will cause a validation failure as the template is
configured as publish-to-pypi but the project is not published.

Change-Id: I1611db9a3c4f89d3cb40d3c253b4e91f8201d443
"}, {'created': '2018-11-21 12:46:48.000000000', 'message': "ansible-role-* projects switch to non-pypi jobs

Switch the release jobs for ansible-role-redhat-subscription,
ansible-role-container-registry and ansible-role-chrony to non-pypi,
these projects are Ansible modules, we don't want it in pypi.

Besides, they are not published into pypi and any new release
request will cause a validation failure as the template is
configured as publish-to-pypi but the project is not published.

Change-Id: I1611db9a3c4f89d3cb40d3c253b4e91f8201d443
"}, {'created': '2018-11-27 11:21:38.000000000', 'message': "Remove ansible-role-redhat-subscription from central repo

Move ansible-role-redhat-subscription templates definition from
project-config into its own repository's zuul configuration.

Change-Id: I1611db9a3c4f89d3cb40d3c253b4e91f8201d443
Depends-On: I83ec850c5b9738c48c2ac9e800dc100368aeaa4b
"}, {'created': '2018-11-28 10:18:32.000000000', 'message': "Remove ansible-role-redhat-subscription from central repo

Move ansible-role-redhat-subscription templates definition from
project-config into its own repository's zuul configuration.

Change-Id: I1611db9a3c4f89d3cb40d3c253b4e91f8201d443
"}]
commit_message:
Remove ansible-role-redhat-subscription from central repo

Move ansible-role-redhat-subscription templates definition from
project-config into its own repository's zuul configuration.

Change-Id: I1611db9a3c4f89d3cb40d3c253b4e91f8201d443

[{'account_id': 1926, 'date': '2018-07-31 09:45:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14629, 'date': '2018-07-31 09:46:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Zuul encountered a syntax error while parsing its configuration in the
repo openstack/ironic on branch master.  The error was:

  The key "IRONIC_USE_LINK_LOCAL" appears more than once; duplicate keys
  are not permitted.

The error appears in the following stanza:

  BUILD_TIMEOUT: 1200
          OS_TEST_TIMEOUT: 2400
          IRONIC_USE_LINK_LOCAL: True
          OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE: True
          IRONIC_USE_LINK_LOCAL: True
          OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE: brbm
          PHYSICAL_NETWORK: mynetwork
          IRONIC_PROVISION_NETWORK_NAME: ironic-provision
          IRONIC_PROVISION_SUBNET_PREFIX: 10.0.5.0/24
          IRONIC_PROVISION_SUBNET_GATEWAY: 10.0.5.1
          Q_PLUGIN: ml2
          Q_USE_PROVIDERNET_FOR_PUBLIC: False
          ENABLE_TENANT_VLANS: True
          Q_ML2_TENANT_NETWORK_TYPE: vlan
          TENANT_VLAN_RANGE: 100:150
          IRONIC_ENABLED_NETWORK_INTERFACES: flat,neutron
          IRONIC_NETWORK_INTERFACE: neutron
          IRONIC_AUTOMATED_CLEAN_ENABLED: False
          TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY: 4
          IRONIC_DEFAULT_DEPLOY_INTERFACE: direct
          IRONIC_TEMPEST_WHOLE_DISK_IMAGE: True
          IRONIC_VM_EPHEMERAL_DISK: 0
          IRONIC_VM_COUNT: 7

  in "openstack/ironic/zuul.d/ironic-jobs.yaml@master", line 109, column 9'}, {'account_id': 1926, 'date': '2018-07-31 10:14:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1926, 'date': '2018-07-31 10:44:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1926, 'date': '2018-07-31 13:34:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2018-07-31 16:00:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-28 14:37:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix default value of subnet attribute for subnet onboard

In its current state, the subnet onboard extension forces callers
to pass a value for the subnet attribute extension. This is not
required when performing operations on a subnet pool, but the
validator forces a value to be sent on the request. This change
simply adjusts the default value of the subnet attribute in the
subnet onboard extension so that an empty list is assumed. This
allows for backward compatible operation of the subnetpool API,
allowing callers to choose not to pass this attribute when it
is not needed in a request.

Change-Id: I6c0b5aa784a380502b9e5fd062dacd10a95b4cbf
Partially-Implements: blueprint subnet-onboard
'}]
commit_message:
Fix default value of subnet attribute for subnet onboard

In its current state, the subnet onboard extension forces callers
to pass a value for the subnet attribute extension. This is not
required when performing operations on a subnet pool, but the
validator forces a value to be sent on the request. This change
simply adjusts the default value of the subnet attribute in the
subnet onboard extension so that an empty list is assumed. This
allows for backward compatible operation of the subnetpool API,
allowing callers to choose not to pass this attribute when it
is not needed in a request.

Change-Id: I6c0b5aa784a380502b9e5fd062dacd10a95b4cbf
Partially-Implements: blueprint subnet-onboard

commit_message:
Extend ml2 plugin to notify nova of port status

- This change modifies the ovn ml2 driver to notify
  nova on port status changes.

- This will help enable faster migration when using
  ml2/ovn in the future by notifying nova once ovn
  has completed wireing up the interface.

Closes-Bug: #1804407
Co-Authored-By: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I450482c542f10c21f210be570df9ec7c9a617c94

commit_message:
Set DeployIdentifier on update/upgrade/ffwd prepare actions

We have separate actions for deploy vs. upgrade prepare, because on
upgrade prepare we don't want to trigger Ansible. DeployIdentifier was
left out from the upgrade prepare action, which got exposed as a bug
after we fixed --skip-deploy-identifier functionality in
Ibab17dcaeebea65135fca4f40562109c90f36c27.

Over time it would be good to further improve code sharing between
`overcloud deploy` and `overcloud update/upgrade/ffwd prepare`, but
for now we need a backportable fix so we just set DeployIdentifier in
the upgrade prepare action.

Additionally it turned out that we never updated the plan env via the
UpdateStackAction as intended, which is now fixed too.

Change-Id: Iefaff07995ae47dcef58739eaf90c4026fe255b0
Closes-Bug: #1804858

commit_message:
Move ARA install to end of bootstrap

setup_ara sets up the callback plugins variable
so as it is now, it gets unset during the role
retrieval.  This commit moves it to the end of
bootstrap so that the ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS
is set.

Change-Id: I46ceb2acf377e38b2dc31ffc4a82b7945f8dd4c5
(cherry picked from commit 93831a60915d899e00c0eaa00a1e8b5511de3e88)

An accidential failure in one of the functional tests 
(http://logs.openstack.org/08/619008/6/check/openstacksdk-functional-devstack-tips-python2/4937876/job-output.txt.gz) 
showed, that 
response of metadata change was not checked. In that particular example 
nova returned 500 for one of the metadata deletes, but the testcase has 
not recognized this and went further, what resulted in a later 
asserEquals failure.
So what we need to do here is to check the response of the metadata 
operation and raise an exception if it was not successful

commit_message:
Check result of server metadata operation

An accidental failure in one of the functional tests showed, that
response of metadata change was not checked. In that particular example
nova returned 500 for one of the metadata deletes, but the testcase
has not recognized this and went further, what resulted in a later
asserEquals failure.
So what we need to do here is to check the response of the metadata
operation and raise an exception if it was not successful.

Change-Id: I37bc96531eb37f9f850d5531354bd4db17973406

commit_message:
Release oslo.context 2.22.0

Bumping from 2.21.0 to 2.22.0 since support was added for oslo.context
to handle domain-scoped tokens from keystone.

commit_message:
Add freezer-tempest-plugin as Stein deliverable

freezer-tempest-plugin was not ready, or was missed in Rocky
release. Let's add a deliverable file to make sure we don't
miss it again in Stein.

Change-Id: I0383f4cd35074c87ad4665cfb5ba46a57676fecd

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-01-15 08:20:41.000000000', 'message': "Add return-request-id-to-caller function(v3/contrib)

Add return-request-id-to-caller function to
resources and resource managers in the following files.

* keystoneclient/v3/contrib

The methods in the resource class and resource manager return
a wrapper class that has 'request_ids' property.
The caller can get request ids of the callee via the property.

Change-Id: I5f90c31020e0dd672a160c7b587f41ba8f2b596c
Co-authored-by: Ankit Agrawal <ankit11.agrawal@nttdata.com>
Implements: blueprint return-request-id-to-caller

* keystoneclient/v3/contrib/oauth1/request_tokens.py

The methods in the resource class and resource manager return
a wrapper class that has 'request_ids' property.
The caller can get request ids of the callee via the property.

commit_message:
Add return-request-id-to-caller function(v3/contrib)

Added return-request-id-to-caller function tovresources and resource
managers in the following files.

* keystoneclient/v3/contrib/simple_cert.py
* keystoneclient/v3/contrib/endpoint_policy.py
* keystoneclient/v3/contrib/oauth1/access_tokens.py
* keystoneclient/v3/contrib/oauth1/request_tokens.py

Adding request-id to below V3 contrib API's is covered in base patch
[1] but this patch is specifically for V3 API's so covered their test
cases in this patch.

* keystoneclient/v3/contrib/endpoint_filter.py
* keystoneclient/v3/contrib/federation/identity_providers.py
* keystoneclient/v3/contrib/federation/mappings.py
* keystoneclient/v3/contrib/federation/protocols.py
* keystoneclient/v3/contrib/federation/service_providers.py

The methods in the resource class and resource manager return
a 'base.Response' class that has 'request_ids' property.
The caller can get request ids of the callee via that property.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329913

Change-Id: I5f90c31020e0dd672a160c7b587f41ba8f2b596c
Co-authored-by: Dinesh Bhor <dinesh.bhor@nttdata.com>
Co-authored-by: Ankit Agrawal <ankit11.agrawal@nttdata.com>
Co-authored-by: Neha Alhat <neha.alhat@nttdata.com>
Implements: blueprint return-request-id-to-caller

subject: Allow placement to start without a config file

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-20 17:48:35.000000000', 'message': 'Allow placement to start without a config file

With oslo.config 6.7.0 configuration options may be found in environment
variables. Because of the small number of options that placement
requires to run it is straightforward to source all config from the
environment, useful in container-based environments.

However, prior to this change, placement-the-wsgi-app required that a
configuration file existed, placement.conf, either in /etc/placement or
in a custom directory.

This change makes it so that the placement.conf can be any of:

* in the custom directory
* in the default project locations (including /etc/placement)
* nowhere

The change maintains the behavior that if
[placement_database]/connection is not set the application will fail to
start.

Closes-Bug: #1802925
Change-Id: Iefa8ad22dcb6a128293ea71ab77c377db56e8d70
'}, {'created': '2018-11-20 23:56:55.000000000', 'message': 'Allow placement to start without a config file

in a custom directory.

This change makes it so that the placement.conf can be any of:

* in the custom directory
* in the default project locations (including /etc/placement)
* nowhere

The change maintains the behavior that if
[placement_database]/connection is not set the application will fail to
start.

Closes-Bug: #1802925
Change-Id: Iefa8ad22dcb6a128293ea71ab77c377db56e8d70

start.

Though this change is orthogonal to the oslo.config change, requirements
and lower-constraints are updated to ensure the desired behavior.

Closes-Bug: #1802925
Change-Id: Iefa8ad22dcb6a128293ea71ab77c377db56e8d70
'}]
commit_message:
Allow placement to start without a config file

With oslo.config 6.7.0 configuration options may be found in environment
variables. Because of the small number of options that placement
requires to run it is straightforward to source all config from the
environment, useful in container-based environments.

However, prior to this change, placement-the-wsgi-app required that a
configuration file existed, placement.conf, either in /etc/placement or
in a custom directory.

This change makes it so that the placement.conf can be any of:

* in the custom directory
* in the default project locations (including /etc/placement)
* nowhere

The change maintains the behavior that if
[placement_database]/connection is not set the application will fail to
start.

Though this change is orthogonal to the oslo.config change, requirements
and lower-constraints are updated to ensure the desired behavior.

Closes-Bug: #1802925
Change-Id: Iefa8ad22dcb6a128293ea71ab77c377db56e8d70

commit_message:
Introduce gate_hook.sh in zunclient

Zunclient is using the script gate_hook.sh located at Zun side.
However, this script causes the failure of the CI.
This patch copies the script to zunclient and modifies it to disable
devstack gate tempest to fix the CI.

Change-Id: I93a4ec8804e74e17c478f2ee2ecf9b3402fcbd3f
(cherry picked from commit d6448c622b57f574ebfdaa24634b3602d290c051)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-19 20:38:57.000000000', 'message': "Correct configuration setting using NUMBER_FAKE_NOVA_COMPUTE

In Change-Id Ia3843818014f7c6c7526ef3aa9676bbddb8a85ca the 'host'
setting used for each of the fake compute hosts was accidentally named
'nhost' ('\nhost' was edited poorly), so the setting doesn't actually do
anything: you create multiple nova-compute processes they think they are
all on the same host and only one hypervisor and resource provider is
created.

With the correction in place, the wait_for_compute function needs to be
updated to be aware of the fact that the hostnames on the compute
services will have a numeric prefix when the fake virt driver is used.

Change-Id: I24b1ac8e773c12675e6b723e646e9e3558ff74e1
"}]
commit_message:
Correct configuration setting using NUMBER_FAKE_NOVA_COMPUTE

In Change-Id Ia3843818014f7c6c7526ef3aa9676bbddb8a85ca the 'host'
setting used for each of the fake compute hosts was accidentally named
'nhost' ('\nhost' was edited poorly), so the setting doesn't actually do
anything: you create multiple nova-compute processes they think they are
all on the same host and only one hypervisor and resource provider is
created.

With the correction in place, the wait_for_compute function needs to be
updated to be aware of the fact that the hostnames on the compute
services will have a numeric prefix when the fake virt driver is used.

Change-Id: I24b1ac8e773c12675e6b723e646e9e3558ff74e1

commit_message:
Handle validation failure if not all switch fields received

The Ironic API has a validation on the LocalLinkConnectionType to
ensure all mandatory values are included. Handle failures which
could occur if the switch does not send all mandatory fields.

Change-Id: I8716a69586265a58520cc2c6bc0bbc00a7c159da
Story: 2004238
Task: 27761
(cherry picked from commit b235c9fee6df4627bdf7c2e85633e15d7884bb2b)

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: I988bcd75a4d81e362fe737b1459d6a593dbc74f4
Related-Bug: 1801465

commit_message:
Correct "openstack sfc port create" and delete superfluous "\"

In my opinion, create Neutron ports on network should be used
"openstack port create".

Change-Id: I168562c11ef13f57037d7d73b463318390b264fb

[{'created': '2018-10-26 10:01:27.000000000', 'message': 'Add protocol to port_forwarding uniq constraint

Floating IP port_forwardings with different protocols can not have
the same internal or external port number to the same VM port. But
we can have different application server, for instance TCP server
and UDP server, listen to the same port at same time.

This patch adds the protocol attribute to the DB uniq constraint
to allow create different protocol port_forwardings with same
internal or external port number.

Co-Authored-By: LIU Yulong <i@liuyulong.me>
Closes-Bug: #1799155
Change-Id: Ifbb5f3ee2473aac98982bff0d2e6bb9b3e5ab5d6

commit_message:
Add protocol to port_forwarding uniq constraint

Floating IP port forwardings with different protocols can not have
the same internal or external port number to the same VM port. But
we can have different application servers, for instance TCP server
and UDP server, listen to the same port at same time.

This patch adds the protocol attribute to the DB uniq constraint
to allow creating different protocol port forwardings with same
internal or external port number.

Co-Authored-By: LIU Yulong <i@liuyulong.me>
Closes-Bug: #1799155
Change-Id: Ifbb5f3ee2473aac98982bff0d2e6bb9b3e5ab5d6

Originally segments extension used it's own placement client.
Now in neutron-lib there is a working actively designed and  tested
client for placement, thus we can change segments to use that, and
remove the old placement client from neutron.

commit_message:
segments use neutron_lib placement client

Originally segments extension used it's own placement client.
Now in neutron-lib there is a working actively designed and  tested
client for placement, thus we can change segments to use that, and
remove the old placement client from neutron.

Change-Id: I2e7b53fdedb1837ddb0d685718d9a811ddac5733
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/580665

commit_message:
Update swift_backup workflow success status message

The result of the tripleo.parameters.update action
shows the entire plan. When the TripleO client displays
the zaqar queue this results in an overly verbose
message being displayed. Rather than display the
full output of the task, display only a summary
of what the task did.

Change-Id: I6520d0ca2e57030f452369360c1e9122353d7f8d
Closes-Bug: #1804312
(cherry picked from commit cebf6d7e327141dfc0231e45a4b73b1c9e8ff293)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-29 13:11:30.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent reverting resizes from leaking files

When reverting resizes, the manager will request instance files
cleanup to be skipped if the hosts use shared storage, in which
case we'd leak files if multiple CSVs are used.

It's safe to cleanup the instance files when reverting resizes
as long as we preserve the "*_revert" dir.

Closes-Bug: #1805833

Change-Id: I09428c2e25bed41f99b51c08a677d7152d9680ee
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent reverting resizes from leaking files

When reverting resizes, the manager will request instance files
cleanup to be skipped if the hosts use shared storage, in which
case we'd leak files if multiple CSVs are used.

It's safe to cleanup the instance files when reverting resizes
as long as we preserve the "*_revert" dir.

Closes-Bug: #1805833

Change-Id: I09428c2e25bed41f99b51c08a677d7152d9680ee

subject: Report the correct image format to glance when snapshotting
messages: [{'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2018-11-29 13:10:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-11-29 13:22:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2018-11-29 14:14:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-29 13:10:50.000000000', 'message': 'Report the correct image format to glance when snapshotting

When taking instance snapshots, the image format is always set to
"vhd", but it may as well be vhdx. This happens because of legacy
reasons, as Glance used to reject vhdx images.

Cinder started to validate the image formats a few releases ago for
security reasons, so it will reject creating volumes from Glance
images that have incorrect image formats.

This change ensures that we'll set the right image format when taking
snapshots.

Closes-Bug: #1805442

Change-Id: Ie151ed15bc806e0c16a363734d0c078fe358b899
'}]
commit_message:
Report the correct image format to glance when snapshotting

When taking instance snapshots, the image format is always set to
"vhd", but it may as well be vhdx. This happens because of legacy
reasons, as Glance used to reject vhdx images.

Cinder started to validate the image formats a few releases ago for
security reasons, so it will reject creating volumes from Glance
images that have incorrect image formats.

This change ensures that we'll set the right image format when taking
snapshots.

Closes-Bug: #1805442

Change-Id: Ie151ed15bc806e0c16a363734d0c078fe358b899

Set dhcp_domain for nova-metadata-api

For guest operating systems that rely on nova metadata rather than dhcp
offers for host dns domain settings it is necessary to set dhcp_domain
in the nova.conf.

commit_message:
Enable support to pass override option to tempestconf

This patch adds the variable tempest_tempestconf_extra_cli_call_overrides
that can be passed as dictionary and will override some default options
in tempestconf.

Change-Id: I1466b04ab377a93d4dd1f62564fcb49b863a1229

[{'created': '2018-11-22 13:25:19.000000000', 'message': 'Bug fix: delete outdated entities for OpenStack datasources

OpenStack datasources delete entities from Vitrage when they
receive a notification about an entity deletion (e.g. nova.instance.delete.end).
However, notifications may be missed sometimes. As a fallback,
the consistency enforcer should delete entities that were not
updated for a while, if they belong to datasources that implement
should_delete_outdated_entities=True

In general, every datasource that supports get_all should override
this function with True.

Change-Id: I67c1c8b2a7d944d0be4d030c66188e950617b1a8
'}, {'created': '2018-11-25 16:11:52.000000000', 'message': 'Bug fix: delete outdated entities for OpenStack datasources

OpenStack datasources delete entities from Vitrage when they
receive a notification about an entity deletion (e.g. nova.instance.delete.end).
However, notifications may be missed sometimes. As a fallback,
the consistency enforcer should delete entities that were not
updated for a while, if they belong to datasources that implement
should_delete_outdated_entities=True

In general, every datasource that supports get_all should override
this function with True.

Change-Id: I67c1c8b2a7d944d0be4d030c66188e950617b1a8
'}]
commit_message:
Bug fix: delete outdated entities for OpenStack datasources

OpenStack datasources delete entities from Vitrage when they
receive a notification about an entity deletion (e.g. nova.instance.delete.end).
However, notifications may be missed sometimes. As a fallback,
the consistency enforcer should delete entities that were not
updated for a while, if they belong to datasources that implement
should_delete_outdated_entities=True

In general, every datasource that supports get_all should override
this function with True.

Change-Id: I67c1c8b2a7d944d0be4d030c66188e950617b1a8

commit_message:
Allow the option to specify OSA git repo URL

Given the leapfrog branches are all EOL and frozen, an operator
may need to make changes to branches on a local repo in order to combat
bit rot over time.

Change-Id: Ia8214a273b38418808b063b0192bbf81bf455daf

commit_message:
Make tenant_id a string in hashmap models

Since scopes are now configurable, the scope_id (tenant_id in hashmap models) is
not necessarily a uuid anymore.

This updates the "mapping" and "threshold" models of
the hashmap module in order to remove uuid validation for the "tenant_id"
field.

Work items:

* Changed the WSME type of tenant_id from Uuid to String

* Added an alembic migration in order to increase the length of tenant_id
  from 36 to 255.

Change-Id: If7dfb82e523ca045c1f266396bc6e01406823f11
Story: 2004200
Task: 27703

commit_message:
haproxy: remove repo_cache service

The repo_cache service was removed in Rocky however we don't
actually remove that file which means the configuration stays.

commit_message:
Add ``service_auth`` section

Octavia requries a ``service_auth`` section in addition to
the ``keystone_authtoken`` section for use with its OpenStack
resource orchestration activities.

In our case they will be equal as we have already branched
service accounts out into a separate doman and project.

Change-Id: I29b15c5eb401646691f5281d2514128c40592613

commit_message:
add python 3.6 unit test job

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.6 as part of the python3-first goal.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I15b5f489891aeaa5191dc7400ef10fe7bd60c201
Story: #2002586

subject: Make Python 3 testing requirement less specific
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 4257, 'name': 'Zane Bitter', 'email': 'zbitter@redhat.com', 'username': 'zaneb'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 10608, 'name': 'Matthew Edmonds', 'email': 'edmondsw@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'edmondsw'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 11805, 'name': 'Corey Bryant', 'email': 'corey.bryant@canonical.com', 'username': 'coreycb'}, {'_account_id': 16643, 'name': 'Goutham Pacha Ravi', 'email': 'gouthampravi@gmail.com', 'username': 'gouthamr'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-10-16 15:23:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-10-16 23:54:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

TBH I don't agree that being less specific is a virtue. People shouldn't have to go do research on Python versions and distro release dates to figure out which versions they should support.

IMO if we think they should support 3.6 then we should add 3.6. And if we don't care about 3.5 we should take that off the list.

Yes, that does mean the TC will have to do something every time the target changes. I don't think that's a bad thing. Somebody needs to be paying attention, because those jobs are not going to change themselves over."}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-17 13:38:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > TBH I don't agree that being less specific is a virtue. People
 > shouldn't have to go do research on Python versions and distro
 > release dates to figure out which versions they should support.
 > 
 > IMO if we think they should support 3.6 then we should add 3.6. And
 > if we don't care about 3.5 we should take that off the list.
 >

One of frustrations I'm seeing as a stakeholder is that some of the though process in the OpenStack realm doesn't align with established software development practices, where software developers consider stakeholder needs. Instead of dictating what Python versions stakeholders should use, OpenStack should proactively test with the Python versions that downstream stakeholders will use with a particular OpenStack release. Currently this is completely out of sync, at least for Ubuntu.

 > Yes, that does mean the TC will have to do something every time the
 > target changes. I don't think that's a bad thing. Somebody needs to
 > be paying attention, because those jobs are not going to change
 > themselves over."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-10-17 13:51:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Corey Bryant wrote:
[...]
> One of frustrations I'm seeing as a stakeholder is that some of the
> though process in the OpenStack realm doesn't align with established
> software development practices, where software developers consider
> stakeholder needs. Instead of dictating what Python versions
> stakeholders should use, OpenStack should proactively test with the
> Python versions that downstream stakeholders will use with a
> particular OpenStack release. Currently this is completely out of
> sync, at least for Ubuntu.
[...]

How is it out of sync? We test with the latest Ubuntu LTS because we understand users are going to be installing on it. If you're saying we should be testing with the *next* (under development) Ubuntu LTS at the same time we're developing the software to run on it, that tends to not work out terribly well. We need to be able to pick a stable test platform at the start of a 6-month development cycle, and have no way of knowing for sure what the upcoming LTS will eventually release with."}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-17 14:01:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Corey Bryant wrote:
 > [...]
 > > One of frustrations I'm seeing as a stakeholder is that some of
 > the
 > > though process in the OpenStack realm doesn't align with
 > established
 > > software development practices, where software developers
 > consider
 > > stakeholder needs. Instead of dictating what Python versions
 > > stakeholders should use, OpenStack should proactively test with
 > the
 > > Python versions that downstream stakeholders will use with a
 > > particular OpenStack release. Currently this is completely out of
 > > sync, at least for Ubuntu.
 > [...]
 > 
 > How is it out of sync? We test with the latest Ubuntu LTS because
 > we understand users are going to be installing on it. If you're
 > saying we should be testing with the *next* (under development)
 > Ubuntu LTS at the same time we're developing the software to run on
 > it, that tends to not work out terribly well. We need to be able to
 > pick a stable test platform at the start of a 6-month development
 > cycle, and have no way of knowing for sure what the upcoming LTS
 > will eventually release with.

Testing on 18.04 LTS is great. What is out of sync is that there's no upstream testing with Python 3.7, which will be the default for Stein on the next Ubuntu development release. Additionally the TC is stating that 3.5 is still required for Stein and downstream Ubuntu won't even target that for stein. Also we're a year and a half from Ubuntu 20.04 which is slated to be Python 3.8. If upstream is testing only on 18.04 with Python 3.6 in a year and a half it is out of sync with stakeholders.

I'm just saying that instead of dictating what versions of python are supported a better approach would be to get stakeholder input and sync with distros to make sure the upstream is testing with the actual versions of python that are going to be used downstream."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-10-17 14:57:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Instead of dictating what Python versions stakeholders should use, OpenStack should proactively test with the Python versions that downstream stakeholders will use with a particular OpenStack release.

I don't see the PTI as dictating what downstream should use per se; it's dictating to projects which test jobs they should be running. And the problem isn't that we're doing too much dictating, but that we're not doing enough. We should have dictated that projects have py36 and py37 jobs a long time ago. (Debian already shipped Rocky on py37 and it caused zigo a lot of pain.)

What you're seeing unfolding here is that we don't really have a good process yet for planning this out in advance (it just wasn't a major issue when all distros were shipping Python 2 by default). And we're trying to both figure one out and play catch-up at the same time."}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-17 15:05:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I don't see the PTI as dictating what downstream should use per se;
 > it's dictating to projects which test jobs they should be running.

Sorry, my comments weren't directed at your change. They were a response to Zane's comments.

 > And the problem isn't that we're doing too much dictating, but that
 > we're not doing enough. We should have dictated that projects have
 > py36 and py37 jobs a long time ago. (Debian already shipped Rocky
 > on py37 and it caused zigo a lot of pain.)
 > 

Fair enough, that is another way to look at it. As long as the dictating aligns with downstream I don't object!

 > What you're seeing unfolding here is that we don't really have a
 > good process yet for planning this out in advance (it just wasn't a
 > major issue when all distros were shipping Python 2 by default).
 > And we're trying to both figure one out and play catch-up at the
 > same time.

Yes and I completely understand that OpenStack is behind on py3 and now we're in a bit of a pickle trying to catch up."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-17 20:19:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

(1 comment)

I'm -1 for some of the same reasons that Zane states, see my comment within.

I also have a more general comment about testing that seems relevant here, but might be just as relevant on Sean's change at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/611080/ but I haven't had a chance to read that one yet, and while it is fresh in my head I want to get it down. I recognise that I'm speaking from ideal-world perspective here, but I think it is important to see that picture and then work back from that to the real world, not start from the real world. Otherwise how are we ever going to get a better world than the icky real one?

We are far too predisposed to testing as much as possible. This is not sustainable. Test nodes are not infinite and unfortunately the nature of our testing is such that it is often necessary to use the CI system for the test-dev-test-dev feedback loop. While we should work to change the nature of our testing so it is more oriented towards developers doing test-dev locally as much as possible, we should also work to ensure that we only add more testing requirements when we remove others.

Furthermore, we (meaning upstream OpenStack and the CI used by it) _should_ be testing our code primarily on the _one_ release of python we expect to be the primary version of python in _new_ deployments at the time of the release of the code. That is: if, at the start of a cycle, we expect the common release to be 3.7, then we should be focussing our limited test resources on 3.7 and only testing other versions if we have a surfeit of testing resources, and even then only the cheap/fast tests (e.g., unit, not integration).

If there are downstream distros that wish to support other versions of Python they should either do that via third party CI, or donate sufficient hardware to create the aforementioned "surfeit".

If we had already established this precedent then there wouldn't be quite the confusion we have now. We'd just know: upstream master is leading, not following, if you need to follow, then that's "on you".

This probably makes it sound like I'm not sympathetic to Corey's plight, but I believe I actually am: I want to remove ambiguity and lack of predictability about who is responsible for what. And, just as importantly insure two things: a) we don't have to play catch up to distros, b) we don't have to play the waiting game with jobs in the queue for hours or days (which makes it more difficult to provide quality code to the downstreams).

So:

* we need to be specific about versions that we test
* when we add a new version we need to remove one or more
* we need to be (slightly) ahead of the norm, not behind, because we release so rarely'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-10-17 21:50:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think we need to decide whether we're assuming users will be installing OpenStack *somehow* on specific distros, or whether they'll be installing the OpenStack *packaged* by those distros. Up to now our testing has been implicitly based on the former assumption.

If we really do want to start targeting platforms which are not yet released, then I think the way we go about setting up our test environments needs to change somewhat significantly. Basically we need to start testing on Debian Unstable instead of Ubuntu LTS and Fedora instead of Centos. This means a fairly constant stream of changes to the underlying platforms, so more frequent breakage for our developers and CI jobs.

If this is an acceptable compromise I can try to come up with an alternative proposal based on the above."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-18 15:47:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> This means a fairly constant stream of
 > changes to the underlying platforms, so more frequent breakage for
 > our developers and CI jobs.
 
To follow up on some of the discussion in today's office hour[1] the point I've been dancing around in my comments is that the kind of breakage that would come from being more modern is a good forcing function for making sure we fix things early and are appropriately engaged with the communities that are upstream of us (python, libvirt, etc).

Breaking tests is a good thing: It's an arbitrary non-human authority that you can't argue with much.


[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-tc/%23openstack-tc.2018-10-18.log.html#t2018-10-18T15:13:36"}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-18 16:53:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

<snip>
 > If we really do want to start targeting platforms which are not yet
 > released, then I think the way we go about setting up our test
 > environments needs to change somewhat significantly. Basically we
 > need to start testing on Debian Unstable instead of Ubuntu LTS and
 > Fedora instead of Centos. This means a fairly constant stream of
 > changes to the underlying platforms, so more frequent breakage for
 > our developers and CI jobs.

Rather than testing against releases under development (that sounds painful) I'd think, at least for Ubuntu, that you'd want to test on interim releases that lead up to an LTS. The Ubuntu releases align very closely with OpenStack. For example the next interim release should be opening next week, will include stein and python 3.7, and should release in April 2019. Another note is that the 19.10 release will include an early version of python 3.8, prior to the 20.04 release.

 > 
 > If this is an acceptable compromise I can try to come up with an
 > alternative proposal based on the above."}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-18 16:59:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Rather than testing against releases under development (that sounds
 > painful) I'd think, at least for Ubuntu, that you'd want to test on
 > interim releases that lead up to an LTS. The Ubuntu releases align
 > very closely with OpenStack. For example the next interim release
 > should be opening next week, will include stein and python 3.7, and
 > should release in April 2019. Another note is that the 19.10
 > release will include an early version of python 3.8, prior to the
 > 20.04 release.
 > 
 
What I meant to say is to test on *released* interim releases that lead up to an LTS. 18.10 releases today with python 3.6 and python 3.7 and could be for used testing python 3.7 on a stable non-LTS release. (We sort of got lucky that we have python 3.7 in 18.04.) And as I mentioned above 19.10 will allow early testing of python 3.8 prior to the 20.04 LTS release."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-10-18 19:20:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Corey Bryant wrote:
[...]
What I meant to say is to test on *released* interim releases that lead up to an LTS. 18.10 releases today with python 3.6 and python 3.7 and could be for used testing python 3.7 on a stable non-LTS release. (We sort of got lucky that we have python 3.7 in 18.04.) And as I mentioned above 19.10 will allow early testing of python 3.8 prior to the 20.04 LTS release.

Switching Ubuntu releases for which we're building images every 6 months also seems labor-intensive, as does tracking release schedules for distros. Does Ubuntu provide a rolling release like Debian/testing or unstable we could just use instead?"}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-18 19:24:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Corey Bryant wrote:
 > [...]
 > What I meant to say is to test on *released* interim releases that
 > lead up to an LTS. 18.10 releases today with python 3.6 and python
 > 3.7 and could be for used testing python 3.7 on a stable non-LTS
 > release. (We sort of got lucky that we have python 3.7 in 18.04.)
 > And as I mentioned above 19.10 will allow early testing of python
 > 3.8 prior to the 20.04 LTS release.
 > 
 > Switching Ubuntu releases for which we're building images every 6
 > months also seems labor-intensive, as does tracking release
 > schedules for distros. Does Ubuntu provide a rolling release like

No there's no rolling release. revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-16 15:23:11.000000000', 'message': 'Make Python 3 testing requirement less specific

Our Python 3 versions used for testing have traditionally followed
the defaults available on the platforms we use to run these tests.
Avoid conflicting with the main PTI by stating this in the Python
PTI document. Drop the caveat saying this only applies to projects
which are compatible with Python 3 since we now expect all
Python-based projects to be working on at least getting (some subset
of) their unit tests working on Python 3.

Change-Id: Iaf2fcd84faa4e6587200dca8ce98e83181a98d6e
'}]
commit_message:
Make Python 3 testing requirement less specific

Our Python 3 versions used for testing have traditionally followed
the defaults available on the platforms we use to run these tests.
Avoid conflicting with the main PTI by stating this in the Python
PTI document. Drop the caveat saying this only applies to projects
which are compatible with Python 3 since we now expect all
Python-based projects to be working on at least getting (some subset
of) their unit tests working on Python 3.

Change-Id: Iaf2fcd84faa4e6587200dca8ce98e83181a98d6e

commit_message:
Fluentbit/Node Exporter: Remove unused tolerations key

This removes the tolerations key from the labels entries. As the
boolean check is on the pod.tolerations.enabled key instead, the
labels.foo.tolerations key is no longer used and should be removed

Change-Id: I00536dabadf9bd354219058d8efd054c60952bbd

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-29 14:38:34.000000000', 'message': "Temporarily disable vexxhost-sjc1 in nodepool

The mirror01.sjc1.vexxhost.openstack.org instance seems to have
become disconnected from the network as of ~02:30 UTC today and is
further unable to reestablish a network connection, even following a
reboot. While we attempt to ressurrect or replace it, take its
region offline in nodepool so that it doesn't create any further
disruption for running jobs.

Change-Id: Ide417bea45b541000ae10ec113de302ed25ffe62
"}]
commit_message:
Temporarily disable vexxhost-sjc1 in nodepool

The mirror01.sjc1.vexxhost.openstack.org instance seems to have
become disconnected from the network as of ~02:30 UTC today and is
further unable to reestablish a network connection, even following a
reboot. While we attempt to ressurrect or replace it, take its
region offline in nodepool so that it doesn't create any further
disruption for running jobs.

Change-Id: Ide417bea45b541000ae10ec113de302ed25ffe62

subject: deprecated puppet-aodh
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 9414, 'name': 'zhongshengping', 'email': 'chdzsp@163.com', 'username': 'ZhongShengping'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 15519, 'name': 'Iury Gregory Melo Ferreira', 'display_name': 'Iury Gregory', 'email': 'iurygregory@gmail.com', 'username': 'iurygregory'}, {'_account_id': 16137, 'name': 'Tobias Urdin', 'email': 'tobias.urdin@binero.com', 'username': 'tobasco'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2018-10-18 14:51:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-10-18 14:52:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Aodh getting deprecated this cycle?'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-10-22 09:14:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

IRC history:

10:26 < tobias-urdin> sileht: regarding https://review.openstack.org/#/c/611635/
10:27 < tobias-urdin> will aodh get removed in the future i.e deprecated stein cycle?
10:33 < sileht> tobias-urdin, aodh is not going to be deprecated, only the puppet/tripleo integration is deprecated
10:44 < tobias-urdin> it should be deprecated in tripleo then not puppet-aodh :)
10:49 < sileht> tobias-urdin, tripleo guys asks me to do both, so I do
10:59 < tobias-urdin> hm, ok do you have a ref who i could talk to?
11:00 < sileht> tobias-urdin, well puppet-aodh is not going to be updated anymore, since its contributors are tripleo folks
11:00 < sileht> tobias-urdin, aodh is not really updated since a while
11:02 < sileht> tobias-urdin, just discus that on the review and we will see what other said
11:02 < tobias-urdin> yes the tripleo people are the majority of puppet modules contributors but the puppet-aodh module is under the puppet openstack project and is used by tripleo but not 
                      the same project
11:02 < tobias-urdin> sure, thanks for updating me'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-10-22 09:15:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

My view: puppet-aodh is under the Puppet OpenStack project and, the majority of the contributors is indeed TripleO people but the module is consumed by TripleO not owned by that project.

My point is that, if TripleO deprecates their Aodh support, or the usage of Puppet for that purpose that is done in there and does not affect the puppet-aodh module since it's not the same project."}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-10-22 09:16:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

As long as the Aodh project is alive this module will be consumed by other parts than the TripleO project itself.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-10-22 14:45:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

if aodh lives on, we should not deprecate this module.'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2018-11-29 15:24:36.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Fix section keystone_authtoken of sahara.conf

Tested on Rocky, it seems there is no admin_* variables and some others
are missing (username/password/...) causing keystone to return http code
400 responses.

Change-Id: If4a0919bfcd6b8d8a6bfd5df9001b4967e441e7e
Closes-Bug: #1805714

commit_message:
deprecate pki related options

check_revocations_for_cached and hash_algorithms are deprecated for
removel because of PKI token format is no longer supported.
Update warning message and add a release note.

Change-Id: Idb200319b86062f0d145cd1650349dd8337a953d
Closes-Bug: #1804562

commit_message:
Fix QoS alias api definition

Change [1] wrongly attempted to re-define bandwidth_limit_rules,
dscp_marking_rules and minimum_bandwidth_rules as first level API
resources, leading to conflicts in the QoS API. We now define
alias_bandwidth_limit_rules, alias_dscp_marking_rules and
alias_minimum_bandwidth_rules that will enable users to perform GET,
PUT and DELETE operations on the corresponding QoS rules without having
to specify the associated policy ID.

[1] I5366dfee9b760ff5c884981582cdd17245b4d16f

Change-Id: I978668ee073c26d6e05ea5e5a0a4e16a7e513fa1
Partial-Bug: #1777627

(3 comments)

Thanks for the review, One query, changed_when will be used only when above shell command fails? Or am I missing something?'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-11-26 13:34:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-11-27 09:25:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

> (3 comments)
 > 
 > Thanks for the review, One query, changed_when will be used only
 > when above shell command fails? Or am I missing something?

By default shell scripts are always marked as "changed" if return code is 0, failed when rc != 0. Ansible has no way to know more about what you run in shell script. You should therefore add conditions for marking a shell script as 'changed' or 'ok' if no changes happen.

In this case, running the shell script is non-change, only displaying information. Therefore we should add a condition for changes, and mark this shell script is NEVER a change, that's why you should write
`changed_when: False`.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-11-27 09:33:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-11-27 17:44:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Added task to list tempest tests

tempest list-plugins just lists the installed tempest plugins
discovered by tempest and it does not gurantee that listed
tempest plugins tests are going to get listed/discovered by the
tempest runner.
tempest run -l will list all the tempest tests by checking relative
imports of the listed tests and making sure we are good to run the
tests by using tempest run and helps to avoid import errors during
the running of tempest tests.

Change-Id: Ie1a9266ade6ef0cd411ad0f32ffc3d496d7bde0f

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I4e87085c6cbb24367d8a7f839b4811d049ba7bf1
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Deprecate pki related options

check_revocations_for_cached and hash_algorithms are deprecated for
removel because of PKI token format is no longer supported.
Update warning message and add a release note.

Change-Id: If6a8d4a55316103b8aad2e65796bfcafe807d231
Closes-Bug: #1804562
Closes-Bug: #1804720

commit_message:
Remove unused functions from devstack/plugin.sh

Seems like get_distutils_data_path and
get_hyperkube_container_cacert_setup_dir functions in plugin.sh are not
mentioned anywhere in the project. This commit removes them.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ie591d2bb8df492f34e55bb2e6c5923d51fb300dc

Octavia (and other projects) is doing that for a while - before stating
devstack-gate they're checking if nested virtualization is available. If
it is, a DevStack option enabling it is turned on. This commit does the
same for Kuryr's jobs running Octavia.

Please note that limestone and ovh clouds are blacklisted as they're

may change in the future.

commit_message:
Enable KVM on Octavia jobs when nested virt is on

Octavia (and other projects) is doing that for a while - before stating
devstack-gate they're checking if nested virtualization is available. If
it is, a DevStack option enabling it is turned on. This commit does the
same for Kuryr's jobs running Octavia.

Please note that limestone and ovh clouds are blacklisted as they're
suffering from kernel bug that makes them unable to work with KVM. This
may change in the future.

Change-Id: Ic54dd5614e9294676fd55fdca91f2f8aed2cdd70

commit_message:
Ensure that a consistent mirror is used for RDO

This patch replicates the code added to openstack-ansible-tests into
the integrated repo. It obtains a URL for the RDO repo at the start
of a job which then has consistent contents for the duration of the job.

Change-Id: I6492c66ccc9d2b5b6de9ab6d08b377ac9e18e153
(cherry picked from commit 11a71e11313f7a424558c7d78f1a00e3b58b9565)

commit_message:
Add MariaDB infrastructure mirrors

In order to ensure that deployment tests make use of the
OpenStack-CI cached resources, we implement the override
to consume them for the MariaDB packages.

Change-Id: Id6982945509a174b0aaa74ccbdfa45adc5cfbb7a
(cherry picked from commit 28f71196cde2b5bf440b909890126ecb55edb6db)

associated story.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-28 14:05:22.000000000', 'message': 'Set SUSE ceph-distro job to non-voting

In https://review.openstack.org/616481 we switched OSA stable/rocky
from ceph-ansible 3.2 to 3.1, but https://review.openstack.org/614463
made the job voting before that merged. The 3.1 builds for SUSE do not
work (see related bug), so we switch this job to non-voting. Whenever
the issue is fixed upstream, we can revert this (and add the missing
gate job too).

Change-Id: I70059d1b0f9eb774519420b14239ab7e3081e7eb
Related-Bug: #1805637
'}]
commit_message:
Set SUSE ceph-distro job to non-voting

In https://review.openstack.org/616481 we switched OSA stable/rocky
from ceph-ansible 3.2 to 3.1, but https://review.openstack.org/614463
made the job voting before that merged. The 3.1 builds for SUSE do not
work (see related bug), so we switch this job to non-voting. Whenever
the issue is fixed upstream, we can revert this (and add the missing
gate job too).

Change-Id: I70059d1b0f9eb774519420b14239ab7e3081e7eb
Related-Bug: #1805637

commit_message:
Add charmhelpers to sys.path in first position for actions

This patch inserts the hooks directory in the first position to always
prefer that version over any other available in the system.

Change-Id: I8d78f0ef9e11f23224e893178c2cd37fdcc42671
Closes-Bug: 1802182
(cherry picked from commit 25200b5a1611280d5f05854eaeb2d00816428a9f)

commit_message:
Add '/usr/share/ansible-modules' at ansible.cfg

Deployments that uses mistral can pass module_path option, and they are
always pointing it to /usr/share/ansible-modules, this review harcode
this value as is just an append to the default values and make possible
to use ansible-pacemaker RPM at standalone, since standalone is not
using mistral.

Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/410?kanban-status=1447276

Change-Id: I024595ed25c6726dbf503eb789b24fd91c38ae28

commit_message:
IPv6 support for ODL-OVS deployment

Add feature to also set OVS manager to the IPv6
address of ODL based on "enable_ipv6" flag value.

Change-Id: I88d369082de1ce71cdeddf69287867c0af6d9e07
Closes-Bug: #1783067
(cherry picked from commit c4e58a8f44233bd163a0d3345894a924ac4274a4)

commit_message:
Work out situation with KUBERNETES_NODE_NAME

This reverts commit f0cde86ee68027bd66597f2e4b8db4e10fa81e0b as it turns
out that variable is actually used by kuryr-daemon and fixes the way
kuryr-controller detects its identity to match how leader-elector is
doing it.

Change-Id: I95c2d3e1760a938d40d57a99fb87b6f02ca7f64a
Closes-Bug: 1798835

commit_message:
Set region_id for karbor_client

region_id has a default value hardcoded in Karbor code equal to
"RegionOne" which could be an issue if a different region is define.

Change-Id: Ia13496156515d0f871e8fa9bd3584940a32759e9
Closes-Bug: #1798125

commit_message:
Add ctlplane interface routes

For the isolated networks we use the subnets host_routes
to set and get the routes for overcloud node interfaces.

This change add's this to the ctlplane interface.

Partial: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Change-Id: Id4cf0cc17bc331ae27f8d0ef8f285050330b7be0

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary logs due to misconfiguration from pacemaker

This happens because pacemaker bind mounts the
/var/log/pacemaker/bundles/<bundle> to /var/log/ in the container
and so it will be missing there.

Tested this on a queens deployment with this change and correctly
observed that no lines like the following appear in the logs:

  su:pam_lastlog(su:session): unable to open /var/log/btmp: No such file or directory

Change-Id: I2f028ec7ac6cb280f5ddf30b12ff138cf20cd0fd
Closes-Bug: 1799716

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-22 10:56:01.000000000', 'message': 'Install UEFI related package for nova image

- for x86_64 arch, install OVMF for RHEL family and ovmf for Debian
  family
- for aarch64 arch, install AAVMF for RHEL family and qemu-efi for
  Debian family
- there is no package support for ppc64le

Closes-Bug: #1796558
Change-Id: Ie1c688e74ec2aa3b6169c0a18a856dd0c92fe443

commit_message:
Install UEFI related package for nova image

- for x86_64 arch, install OVMF for RHEL family and ovmf for Debian
  family
- for aarch64 arch, install AAVMF for RHEL family and qemu-efi for
  Debian family
- there is no package support for ppc64le

Closes-Bug: #1796558
Change-Id: Ie1c688e74ec2aa3b6169c0a18a856dd0c92fe443
(cherry picked from commit 60009339827ff81537d80f6a6d3dfa23ad36dbf1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-28 14:13:44.000000000', 'message': "Add openstack-helm repo images

This adds the building of the images present in the OpenStack-Helm
repository.

Images follow the same process as images from the osh-infra
repository.

Kubernetes-entrypoint need refactoring to be independant of the
Makefile, and therefore was not included in this patch, because
it was not following other images' building process.

Likewise, LOCI is not following these images building process,
and therefore will be included in a different patch.

The manual build script do not expose the extra arguments
previously exposed, like KUBE_VERSION or OVS_VERSION by default.
It also means a future tagged version of this repository will
use the KUBE_VERSION or OVS_VERSION that are in tree, and
therefore very explicit.

Change-Id: If4ff73c37ed8bccb9f6951f3ccdbb7640e9b55a5

commit_message:
Add openstack-helm repo images

This adds the building of the images present in the OpenStack-Helm
repository.

Images follow the same process as images from the osh-infra
repository.

Kubernetes-entrypoint is not used anymore and therefore was
not migrated over.

Likewise, LOCI is not following these images building process,
and therefore will be included in a different patch.

The manual build script do not expose the extra arguments
previously exposed, like KUBE_VERSION or OVS_VERSION by default.
It also means a future tagged version of this repository will
use the KUBE_VERSION or OVS_VERSION that are in tree, and
therefore very explicit.

Change-Id: If4ff73c37ed8bccb9f6951f3ccdbb7640e9b55a5

From Karbor documentation, endpoints should be created with
"%(project_id)s" and not with "%(tenant_id)s".

This is very important because of this commit in Karbor which is
looking for a string "project_id".

Change-Id: I8fc640891d0d58541198cc8f2e942d8db6e8d02f
Closes-Bug: #1805705
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Karbor endpoints

From Karbor documentation, endpoints should be created with
"%(project_id)s" and not with "%(tenant_id)s".

This is very important because of this commit in Karbor which is
looking for a string "project_id".

Change-Id: I8fc640891d0d58541198cc8f2e942d8db6e8d02f
Closes-Bug: #1805705

commit_message:
placement: avoid multiple join in _get_all_with_shared

The number of joins used in the _get_all_with_shared is based on
the number of the requested resources. Using single join instead
of multiple join can improve the performance.

Change-Id: Ie78e2b16e2366eae924717897b06c7e23370b399

(6 comments)

Some spelling nits, and an important variable name typo within.

This is complex enough that I'm basically forced to take it on faith. If the tests are correct and pass then cool?

A general statement about shared providers handling, not this specific change: I am, however, a bit confused by the amount of python involved in the solution to managing shared providers. I was under the impression that end goal is a big single SQL statement that gets the whole thing. Is that something we'll try for later or is it simply out of reach because of the kind of manipulations we need to be doing. I ask because it would be a relief to be able to migrate all the manipulation to its own file that we can ensure is thoroughly tested and correct and then not have to see it. The resource_provider.py file is completely overwhelming and I'm unable to generate an iota of confidence that it is correct."}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2017-08-10 12:04:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

(1 comment)

Chris, thanks!

I guess only Jay can answer your question. I remember Jay tell me he didn't expect on single big SQL. But at least, I think we should split the whole '_get_by_filters' into multiple sub-method, and test them by unittest.

It's really hard to debug each corner case for such kind of big method."}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2017-08-10 12:06:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2017-08-10 12:18:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-05 07:13:17.000000000', 'message': 'placement: ensure shared RP maps with correct root RP

The shared resource provider should map with the correct
root resource provider, otherwise the wrong combination of
allocation requests returned AllocationCandidates.get_by_filters().

Change-Id: I7c7ffb0702cea994eef4ff8cadaadccd65b68cd0

commit_message:
placement: ensure RP maps to those RPs that share with it

The current implementation doesn't generate the correct combinations
for the shared resource providers. The following cases are fixed in
this patch:

* Resource providers should only map with those sharing resource providers
that are in the same aggregate,
* The Root ResourceProvider may share multiple resources from multiple
sharing resource providers. The combination should be multiple.
* If not all the resource providers share resources from
same set of sharing resource providers.

Change-Id: I7c7ffb0702cea994eef4ff8cadaadccd65b68cd0
Closes-Bug: #1702420

subject: placement: func tests for multiple shared RPs

commit_message:
placement: func tests for multiple shared RPs

This patch adds two functional tests for the multiple shared resource
providers.

Change-Id: Ia33b708ce46f997d3b85e6ce926e933680ad27ea
Related-Bug: #1702420

commit_message:
devstack: allow overriding keystone config

This patch aims to support using devstack multi host when the undercloud
is not deployed by devstack. This is achieved by allowing the user to
specify different credentials than the ones devstack assumes the service
host in a multi host scenario to have.

Change-Id: I3831f9bd96eac856b522ae27f8bb6d8fd7ddb5c5
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

Change-Id: Ib0cf433163292ee50c946af4e0b88eb3c9ccca00

'}, {'created': '2017-06-13 11:14:03.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] contrib: devstack-overcloud-heat

Change-Id: Ib0cf433163292ee50c946af4e0b88eb3c9ccca00

'}, {'created': '2017-06-14 10:08:50.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] contrib: devstack-overcloud-heat

Implements: blueprint devstack-deployment-tool
Change-Id: Ib0cf433163292ee50c946af4e0b88eb3c9ccca00
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>
'}, {'created': '2017-06-14 11:08:42.000000000', 'message': "contrib: devstack-overcloud-heat

This commit adds a new executable to devstack-heat that allows you to
deploy overclouds

If your undercloud is not set up by devstack. I recommend using:

    ./devstack-overcloud-heat stack --override-keystone <gerrit_number>

This will make kuryr-kubernetes use the same credentials and the same
keystone that you are using to call ./devstack-overcloud-heat (the one
in the openrc you sourced).

To unstack:

    ./devstack-overcloud-heat unstack name_of_my_stack

Note that if you unstack with the openstack cli instead, it will get
stuck and you'll have a world of pain to unstack (dealing with hooks).

It is important to delete all the subports created in the overcloud for
pods before unstacking, otherwise the unstacking will fail, since the
trunks won't be allowed to be eliminated.

Implements: blueprint devstack-deployment-tool
Change-Id: Ib0cf433163292ee50c946af4e0b88eb3c9ccca00
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>
"}, {'created': '2017-06-15 09:04:21.000000000', 'message': "contrib: devstack-overcloud-heat

This commit adds a new executable to devstack-heat that allows you to
deploy overclouds

If your undercloud is not set up by devstack. I recommend using:

    ./devstack-overcloud-heat stack --override-keystone <gerrit_number>

This will make kuryr-kubernetes use the same credentials and the same
keystone that you are using to call ./devstack-overcloud-heat (the one
in the openrc you sourced).

To unstack:

    ./devstack-overcloud-heat unstack name_of_my_stack

Note that if you unstack with the openstack cli instead, it will get
stuck and you'll have a world of pain to unstack (dealing with hooks).

It is important to delete all the subports created in the overcloud for
pods before unstacking, otherwise the unstacking will fail, since the
trunks won't be allowed to be eliminated.

Implements: blueprint devstack-deployment-tool
Change-Id: Ib0cf433163292ee50c946af4e0b88eb3c9ccca00
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
contrib: devstack-overcloud-heat

This commit adds a new executable to devstack-heat that allows you to
deploy overclouds

If your undercloud is not set up by devstack. I recommend using:

    ./devstack-overcloud-heat stack --override-keystone <gerrit_number>

This will make kuryr-kubernetes use the same credentials and the same
keystone that you are using to call ./devstack-overcloud-heat (the one
in the openrc you sourced).

To unstack:

    ./devstack-overcloud-heat unstack name_of_my_stack

Note that if you unstack with the openstack cli instead, it will get
stuck and you'll have a world of pain to unstack (dealing with hooks).

It is important to delete all the subports created in the overcloud for
pods before unstacking, otherwise the unstacking will fail, since the
trunks won't be allowed to be eliminated.

Implements: blueprint devstack-deployment-tool
Change-Id: Ib0cf433163292ee50c946af4e0b88eb3c9ccca00
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

subject: Wait for auditplans to finish and before creating audits
messages:
[{'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2018-11-21 11:22:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2018-11-21 11:25:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I am not very sure about this one, as I was not able to reproduce the failure http://logs.openstack.org/88/612988/6/check/watcher-tls-test/d29f27a/ locally, maybe flaky or my setup did not match that of CI.

And also there was an existing patch merged for the failure on 16/11/18, and but this one failed on 22/11/18 !'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2018-11-21 14:54:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2018-11-28 01:56:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 19055, 'date': '2018-11-28 09:06:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Hmm, this limitation looks a little bit curiously to me, since there can be different audits with different resource scopes which aren't overlaps each other. In such case, why should we prevent execution of audit with absolutely different resources?

Maybe we should add an optional argument "--force" to "watcher audit create" command that would allow operator to execute audit despite of active action plans?'}, {'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2018-11-29 02:51:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Hmm, this limitation looks a little bit curiously to me, since
 > there can be different audits with different resource scopes which
 > aren't overlaps each other. In such case, why should we prevent
 > execution of audit with absolutely different resources?
 > 
 > Maybe we should add an optional argument "--force" to "watcher
 > audit create" command that would allow operator to execute audit
 > despite of active action plans?
I also think this limit is too strict. but it's difficult to check if
the different audits have the same scope. 
adding an optional argument "--force" is good for oneshot audit, but for
continuous audit, I don't know how to deal with this argument.
In addition, I think it is beyond this patch.'}, {'account_id': 19055, 'date': '2018-11-29 09:23:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> > Hmm, this limitation looks a little bit curiously to me, since
 > > there can be different audits with different resource scopes
 > which
 > > aren't overlaps each other. In such case, why should we prevent
 > > execution of audit with absolutely different resources?
 > >
 > > Maybe we should add an optional argument "--force" to "watcher
 > > audit create" command that would allow operator to execute audit
 > > despite of active action plans?
 > I also think this limit is too strict. but it's difficult to check
 > if
 > the different audits have the same scope.
 > adding an optional argument "--force" is good for oneshot audit,
 > but for
 > continuous audit, I don't know how to deal with this argument.
 > In addition, I think it is beyond this patch.

Of course, that's beyond this patch.'}]

commit_message:
Wait for auditplans to finish and before creating audits

if an auditplan is underway any new audit are immediately marked
CANCELLED. So the existing retry loop immediately returns retrying
immediately instead of retrying for 30secs

Instead we should wait only on the audits created by this test.

Partial-Bug:  #1801295
Change-Id: Ib8d0a7e0bd57c75ac2fa6a0a6e94698d849e4255

If invalid json is included as the last element in
os_config_files.json it can silently break the file
customizations managed by os-apply-config.

More details:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1493303

Closes-Bug: #1722321
rhbz#1653510

Change-Id: I0ad89fcde101ba6f3723ab2fa5a348c40452bae5
(cherry picked from commit f462d6fec8a4ae5c76a8f5e0d36e5dbb48917256)
'}]
commit_message:
fixes how os-apply-config handles invalid json

If invalid json is included as the last element in
os_config_files.json it can silently break the file
customizations managed by os-apply-config.

More details:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1493303

Closes-Bug: #1722321
rhbz#1653510

Change-Id: I0ad89fcde101ba6f3723ab2fa5a348c40452bae5
(cherry picked from commit f462d6fec8a4ae5c76a8f5e0d36e5dbb48917256)

[{'created': '2018-11-26 22:20:58.000000000', 'message': 'Enhance test to prevent JSON parsing regression

Change I43782d245d7652ba69613b26fe598ac79ec19929 added a policy
file parsing optimization that had the affect of allowing some
strictly speaking invalid JSON policy files to be accepted.
Enhance the test for bad JSON to look for this to prevent prevent

commit_message:
Enhance test to prevent JSON parsing regression

Change I43782d245d7652ba69613b26fe598ac79ec19929 added a policy
file parsing optimization that had the affect of allowing some
strictly speaking invalid JSON policy files to be accepted.
Enhance the test for bad JSON to look for this to prevent
formerly acceptable policy files from becoming invalid if
the code is refactored at some point.

Also updates two related comments that had gotten out of sync
with the code.

Change-Id: I6a269b91436cac29bd72e11dbdc51ee74feca028

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-23 10:07:58.000000000', 'message': 'Bump storage available to Docker in CI to 25G

Currently CentOS binary jobs are often failing due to running out of
storage while building images.

See
http://logs.openstack.org/87/612887/8/check/kolla-build-centos-binary/b467920/logs/build/000_FAILED_heat-all.txt.gz
for an example, and
http://logs.openstack.org/87/612887/8/check/kolla-build-centos-binary/b467920/logs/df.txt.gz
for the corresponding df output that shows the /var/lib/docker loopback
mount at 97%.

Change-Id: I2f3d04452c517f8643b124550148cc9d8320b937
'}]
commit_message:
Bump storage available to Docker in CI to 25G

Currently CentOS binary jobs are often failing due to running out of
storage while building images.

See
http://logs.openstack.org/87/612887/8/check/kolla-build-centos-binary/b467920/logs/build/000_FAILED_heat-all.txt.gz
for an example, and
http://logs.openstack.org/87/612887/8/check/kolla-build-centos-binary/b467920/logs/df.txt.gz
for the corresponding df output that shows the /var/lib/docker loopback
mount at 97%.

Change-Id: I2f3d04452c517f8643b124550148cc9d8320b937

commit_message:
Pass dns-domain over neutron-api relation

In order to have nova-metadata-api use the same dns-domain as neutron
when nova-metadata-api runs on nova-cloud-controller we must pass the
dns-domain on the neutron-api relation.

Change-Id: I14fe163a445b6dcffccced762041942de7d6b41d
Partial-Bug: #1805645

For guest operating systems that rely on nova metadata rather than dhcp
offers for host dns domain settings it is necessary to set dhcp_domain
in the nova.conf.

Partial-Bug: #1805645
'}]
commit_message:
Set dhcp_domain for nova-metadata-api

For guest operating systems that rely on nova metadata rather than dhcp
offers for host dns domain settings it is necessary to set dhcp_domain
in the nova.conf.

Change-Id: If7de988ddcd8817d02b261bea601d6922275890c
Partial-Bug: #1805645

subject: Remove pre-emptive boot.ipxe copy
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 19578, 'name': 'Olivier Bourdon', 'email': 'olivierbourdon38@gmail.com', 'username': 'olivierbourdon38'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-10-10 20:26:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-10-11 07:37:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think I get the point you are trying to make here. However the boot.ipxe file is not present at the very end of the bifrost deployment and machines can not be provisioned so there may be something else missing. commit_message:
Remove pre-emptive boot.ipxe copy

Early on in bifrost, we used a static template for
a short time. As time evolved, so did the template,
and we were able to rely upon the conductor placing
the boot.ipxe file upon startup.

Ironic since performed the copy upon driver init
as opposed to once a deployment has been requested.

As it is no longer needed, we shouldn't put an invalid
ipxe boot configuration in place. Removing legacy copy.

Change-Id: I7f2fc2afca6c8ee0f18efe8aa461bf906794e049
